title: Spring Shoots II (Wakana: ge), Calligraphic Excerpt from Chapter 35 of the "Tale of Genji" (Genji monogatari)
description:
Murasaki:

Before the dew dries
That has clung to the lotus-
O fragile fortune-
Surely it would be foolish
To think I shall not be gone.

Genji:

Bind we by an oath:
Let us be as two dewdrops
On one lotus leaf;
Do not let us be apart,
Dear heart, though not in this world.

[Translation by Edwin A. Cranston]
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Bequest of the Hofer Collection of the Arts of Asia
medium: The thirty-fifth of a series of 54 kotobagaki (calligraphic album leaves) mounted in an album with illustrations; ink and color on paper

images.publiccaption: Chapter 35: A is painting on left, B is calligraphy on right
